name: DNB FIRST, N.A., Respondent v. William B. FRETZ Jr., Petitioner; DNB First, N.A., Respondent v. William B. Fretz Jr., Petitioner

parties: DNB FIRST, N.A., Respondent v. William B. FRETZ Jr., Petitioner. DNB First, N.A., Respondent v. William B. Fretz Jr., Petitioner.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 3rd day of December, 2014, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED. The issue, as stated by Petitioner, is:
Whether the Superior Court of Pennsylvania erred in deciding under Pa.R.C.P. 2959(c) that Petitioner waived four of the six meritorious defenses put forth on appeal to open/ strike a confessed judgment, when those defenses were fleshed out in discovery and included in a court sanctioned supplemental brief?
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
107 A.3d 709
DNB FIRST, N.A., Respondent v. William B. FRETZ Jr., Petitioner. DNB First, N.A., Respondent v. William B. Fretz Jr., Petitioner.
Nos. 375 MAL 2014, 376 MAL 2014.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Dec. 3, 2014.
